org.cidarlab.minieugene.dom
Class Component

java.lang.Object
  org.cidarlab.minieugene.dom.Component

public class Component
extends java.lang.Object

A Component represents a rule operand in miniEugene. From a biology perspective, a component can either be a nucleotide, part, device, or systems. I.e. components are agnostic to the level of abstraction.

A component is characterized by four attributes:
- an integer ID (generated by miniEugene)
- a unique name
- a type
- direction (forward/reverse)

The type is automatically derived from the first character of the component's name (not case-sensitive).
p: Promoter, r: RBS, c or g: Gene, t: Terminator
For example, naming a rule operand pTet, miniEugene will infer that pTet is a Promoter.
Also, every type has a unique ID and a name.

Author:
Ernst Oberortner

Method Detail

isForward

public boolean isForward()
isForward/0 returns true if the symbol's orientation is forward, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the symbol has a forward orientation false otherwise

setForward

public void setForward(boolean forward)
setForward/1 is used by miniEugene internally to set the correct orientation of a symbol in a solution.

It is up to you to change the orientation of a symbol while processing the solutions.

Parameters:
forward -
true if the symbol is forward oriented
false, otherwise

public int getId()
getID/0 returns the ID of the symbol

getTypeId

public int getTypeId()
getTypeId/0 returns the type's ID of the component 1 ... Promoter 2 ... RBS 3 ... Gene 4 ... Terminator 5 ... otherwise

Returns:
int ... the type's ID

getTypeName

public java.lang.String getTypeName()
the getTypeName method returns the component's type name derived from the first character of the name of the component. p|P ... Promoter r|R ... RBS c|g|C|G ... Gene t|T ... Terminator

Returns:
the name of the component's type
